column4: does anyone know if theres a program that I can burn to cd, boot and it will allow me to boot from USB drive(s) ?
ive seen some disrtos that have that for their specific disrtos
alt- has a text based installer.
i think that url mentions such tools.
and i think theres more to it then justhosting the install cd
you could have C: be somewhere else.. but proberly C: is a good guess. yes.
i found it easier to just setup a bootale flash drive then mess with netboot/installing
true, but my laptop doesnt support booting from USB :(
ive only seen such things in a few specific cases. and if you had a bootabel cd.. you could just install from that anyway.

bummer.  I recall seeing somewhere a 'net-boot live cd' project. You booted the live-cd on one boxx and it would let you net-boot and install to other machines on the lan. but im not sure how active/useable it even was.
damn :S ,, if u remember, can let me know :)
i must of saw it on some of the UBuntu tutorial sites. but im not evne sure of what the name was.
it might be bookmarked at my  http://delicious.com/tags/dr_willis     page
i never did get that working however.
